Based on the provided information in the context, it mentions different salary heads such as Basic Salary, House Rent Allowance, City Compensatory Allowance, Personal Allowance, and Local Conveyance for Marketing Staff. The actual amount for each of these components will depend on the Hierarchy and Grading of the Employee which will be provided in Annexure-A of the Appointment Letter.

In addition to the salary components, there are also Retirement Benefits like Provident Fund (PF), Employee State Insurance Corporation (ESIC), and Gratuity Scheme. These benefits will be provided to employees as per Government Rules & Regulations and the details of which can be found in the Appointment Letter.

Moreover, regarding gratuity, employees are eligible for this benefit if they complete continuous service of 5 years in the organization, as per the Payment of Gratuity Act, 1972.

It is important to note that the exact salary amount cannot be determined without knowing the specific details of the components (Basic Salary, HRA, etc.) and the employee's Hierarchy and Grading as mentioned in Annexure-A of the Appointment Letter. I recommend referring to your Appointment Letter or contacting the HR department for detailed information on your salary breakdown.
